memberdef.name: LinearSVM

briefdescription.para: Construct the LinearSVM class with the provided data and labels.

detaileddescription.para: This will train the model. Optionally, the parameter 'lambda' can be passed, which controls the amount of L2-regularization in the objective function. By default, the model takes a small value.

parameterdescription.para: Input training features. Each column associate with one sample
Labels associated with the feature data.
Margin of difference between correct class and other classes.

memberdef.name: LinearSVM

briefdescription.para: Initialize the Linear SVM without performing training.

detaileddescription.para: Default value of lambda is 0.0001. Be sure to use Train() before calling Classify() or ComputeAccuracy(), otherwise the results may be meaningless.

parameterdescription.para: Size of the input feature vector.
Margin of difference between correct class and other classes.

memberdef.name: LinearSVM

briefdescription.para: Initialize the Linear SVM without performing training.

detaileddescription.para: Default value of lambda is 0.0001. Be sure to use Train() before calling Classify() or ComputeAccuracy(), otherwise the results may be meaningless.

parameterdescription.para: Margin of difference between correct class and other classes.

briefdescription.para: Classify the given points, returning class scores for each point.

parameterdescription.para: Matrix of data points to be classified.

briefdescription.para: Classify the given points, returning the predicted labels for each point.

detaileddescription.para: The function calculates the probabilities for every class, given a data point. It then chooses the class which has the highest probability among all.

briefdescription.para: Classify the given points, returning class scores and predicted class label for each point.

detaileddescription.para: The function calculates the scores for every class, given a data point. It then chooses the class which has the highest probability among all.

parameterdescription.para: Matrix of data points to be classified.

briefdescription.para: Classify the given point.

detaileddescription.para: The predicted class label is returned. The function calculates the scores for every class, given the point. It then chooses the class which has the highest probability among all.

simplesect.para: Predicted class label of the point.

briefdescription.para: Computes accuracy of the learned model given the feature data and the labels associated with each data point.

detaileddescription.para: Predictions are made using the provided data and are compared with the actual labels.

parameterdescription.para: Matrix of data points using which predictions are made.
Vector of labels associated with the data.

memberdef.name: Train

briefdescription.para: Train the Linear SVM with the given training data.

parameterdescription.para: Input training features. Each column associate with one sample.
Labels associated with the feature data.

simplesect.para: Objective value of the final point.

briefdescription.para: The LinearSVM class implements an L2-regularized support vector machine model, and supports training with multiple optimizers and classification.

detaileddescription.para: The class supports different observation types via the MatType template parameter; for instance, support vector classification can be performed on sparse datasets by specifying arma::sp_mat as the MatType parameter.
Linear SVM can be used for general classification tasks which will work on multiclass classification. More technical details about the model can be found from the following:
An example on how to use the interface is shown below:
